name: The Long Game (MasterProject)
description:
THE LONG GAME

THE LONG GAME is a singleplayer medieval diplomacy game. Play the Prisoner's Dilemma over the course of 6 rounds, investigate opponents' previous matches and influence them by sharing information and telling lies.

THE GAME

The game revolves around The Prisoner's Dilemma, a game theory-related thought experiment. In summary, two players choose a Stance towards each other - the Passive stance is better diplomatically, but opens the player to being betrayed, while the Agressive Stance grants more points but costs an action and creates resentment.

The problem can be represented by this image:

In order to predict the opponent's actions, the player has an array of different actions to investigate and manipulate them.

THE MOVES

Every player has 3 Actions per round, and can perform the following actions:

-Battle: take the Agressive stance against another character.
-Investigation: get more information on another character.
-Influence: change their position on the Throne Track.
-Diplomacy: send messages to other players.

Additionally, the player also has access to an extensive manual with detailed profiles on every aspect of a character's AI, which can be read at any time.

THE CAST GROLK (ORC)

Hates weak and/or traitorous players. Acts agressively and recklessly.

KALLYSTA (TIEFLING)

An individualistic and cunning leader. Kallysta distrusts almost everyone and is great at breaking strong alliances.

THOREN (DWARF)

A great ally and a fearsome opponent. Thoren greatly values loyalty above all else.

EDRAELE (ELF)

Manipulative. Acts friendly but may backstab. Dinamically adapts to the player, takes actions and makes plans.
